intro: Aspilia pallida, commonly known as the white flame flower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking, pale yellow to white inflorescences that resemble a cluster of flames. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Aspilia pallida typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
